lg.l: Loud hail the theme so sweetly pealing,
The voice of Liberty is stealing!
Loud raise your strains, ye humble-minded few;
Let despots hear, and say that ye are free:

Strike home with battle-cry, "For death or liberty."A celebrated Revolutionary slogan. American patriot Patrick Henry was renowned for issuing the rallying cry "Give me liberty, or give me death!" "Gabriel," the enslaved leader of the Virginia uprising known as Gabriel's Rebellion (1800), told supporters that his battle flag would carry the words "death or Liberty" (Douglas R. Egerton, Death or Liberty: African Americans and Revolutionary America [Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2009], 279). Mid-nineteenth-century abolitionists and activists deployed both versions of the phrase.
No more shall sweeping lash make lower
Tyrants, behold! your time is o'er!
The unavenged shall now avenged be;
Hands that have toiled in many cotton fields,
And hearts that only dreamt they should be free;
These hearts and hands the sword of battle wield;
Strike home with battle-cry, "For death or liberty."
